programme.title: The Masters - Live
programme.desc: Coverage of the second day from the Augusta National in Georgia, as the players involved look to make the cut in the first Major of the year. Eventual champion Jordan Spieth increased his lead to five shots after 36 holes with a bogey-free round of 66 at this stage last year, to match the Masters record for the biggest advantage at the halfway point of the event. The leaderboard was dominated by Americans, with Paul Casey and Justin Rose the only European players in the top 10 heading into the weekend.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 92/93 & 93/94. We go back to the start of the first two seasons of the Premier League and take a look at the first 78 goals scored as United recorded back-to-back league titles.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 94/95 & 95/96. Volume 2 takes us from goal 79 to goal 156, including the record 9-0 win over Ipswich and United's fastest Premier League goal, scored by Ryan Giggs.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 96/97 & 97/98. Volume 3 takes us from goal 157 to goal 236, including Eric Cantona's famous chip against Sunderland and another league title for the Reds.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 98/99 & 99/00. Volume 4 takes us from goal 237 to goal 340. The Reds recorded a historic Treble and then went goal crazy, hitting 59 to win the league in 1999/2000.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 00/01 & 01/02. Volume 5 takes us from goal 341 to goal 429, including six of the best in one memorable afternoon against Arsenal.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 02/03 & 03/04. Volume 6 takes us from goal 430 to goal 508. The Reds' faithful were treated to the finishing prowess of Ruud van Nistelrooy, who scored three hat-tricks in 02/03.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 04/05 & 05/06. Volume 7 takes us from goal 509 to goal 576, including Wayne Rooney's majestic volley against Newcastle as he announced himself as the next United superstar.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 06/07 & 07/08. Volume 8 takes us from goal 577 to goal 669, as the Reds reclaimed their Premier League crown and Cristiano Ronaldo scored goal after goal, including 21 in a season.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 08/09 & 09/10. Volume 9 goes from goal 670 to goal 764, including Federico Macheda's debut strike, a four-goal haul for Wayne Rooney and a dream derby winner from Michael Owen.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 10/11 & 11/12. Volume 10 takes us from goal 765 to goal 865, including a memorable derby goal from Wayne Rooney and a remarkable afternoon against Arsenal, as the Reds hit eight.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 12/13 & 13/14. Volume 11 takes us from goal 866 to goal 9­39. Robin van Persie's goals helped the Reds to league title number 20 as Sir Alex Ferguson bowed out in style.(n)

programme.title: OT1000 United Premier League Goals
programme.desc: 14/15 & 15/16. Volume 12 takes us over the finish line, starting with goal 940. The final 60 strikes include memorable debuts for Anthony Martial and Marcus Rashford.(n)

programme.title: Avellino - Pescara (diretta)
programme.desc: Serie B. Anticipo 35a giornata. Il Pescara con la vittoria sul Como ha riportato la squadra in zona playoff, all'ottavo posto. L'Avellino, dopo aver allontanato Tesser, non ha cambiato passo: con Marcolin due partite e un solo punto. E i playoff ormai sono a otto punti anche se un successo sul Pescara potrebbe dare speranza. Telecronaca: Compagnoni-Pellegrini(n)

programme.title: I Signori del Calcio: Cannavaro
programme.desc: L'ex Pallone d'Oro Fabio Cannavaro ripercorre le fasi principali della propria carriera e fa il punto sui suoi progetti futuri. Nella meravigliosa cornice del golfo di Napoli, il campione del mondo 2006 parla del campionato italiano, della sua carriera da allenatore tra speranze e obiettivi, del Napoli di De Laurentiis e della grande stagione di Higuain e, infine, del sogno Nazionale(n)
